We're hiring a REMOTE Marketing Developer at Podia: https://www.podia.com/marketing-developer

Podia is a platform that makes it easy for creators to host and sell online courses, memberships and digital downloads.

Work remotely on interesting growth challenges with an amazing team, and make an impact on thousands of users (and with your help, many thousands more).

++ Why work at Podia? ++

- Ultimate flexibility. We try to have some overlap time every day, but outside of that work whenever & wherever you work best.

- Extreme autonomy. No micro-managing here. You’ll be given high-level direction and then left to solve it the way you feel is best. You’re the expert!

- That said, the rest of the team is always ready to lend a hand — or even an ear if you just need to rubber duck some ideas.

- You get to work with a small, highly-talented team that has built — and continues to build — our business with care.

- Whether it’s fixes, small tweaks, or substantial features, we deploy often. There’s zero red tape to slow you down.

- We have a rapidly growing base of passionate customers, and a much larger market that your projects will be getting in front of. Your work will be seen and appreciated by many people.

- Competitive compensation. We want to hire the best people, and we’re ready to pay for them.

- (Paid for) annual retreats to spend time with the team and have fun together. This year’s retreat was in Portland, Maine!

Application details at https://www.podia.com/marketing-developer

items.title: PR and Media Manager – Select US States
items.content:
PR and Media Manager – Select US States at FlexJobs

Remote

FlexJobs is hiring! Since 2007, our awesome team has been working hard to present professional, legitimate, flexible jobs to our subscribers. In the bigger picture, we aim to make the job search experience a little easier and safer through hand-screened jobs, skills testing, a blog that explores all areas of flexible working, and career coaching for FlexJobs members.

Our mission is to improve the future of work by helping people find flexible jobs that make their lives better. We are committed to doing this internally and externally with integrity, intelligence, balance, communication, and care.

We also walk the talk! Our entire team works remotely from locations all across the United States. The ability to flex our schedules as needed to best fit our lives allows us to work in a very focused and productive way. The teams at FlexJobs collaborate and communicate as needed—whether that’s several times a day or a couple of times a week—to stay connected and engaged with one another.

Here are 5 important things to know about this role:

  • The PR & Media Manager will report to, collaborate with, and support the Director of PR & Media in the strategy and execution of FlexJobs’ overall PR & Media program.
  • A big part of this role will be media relations outreach, particularly building and nurturing relationships with journalists.
  • You need to be to able to thrive and operate in a fast-paced work environment.
  • You need to have a genuine desire to spread the word and an excitement for helping people find better jobs that fit their lives.
  • We are a virtual company, so you need to be completely happy working independently, but also proactive when it comes to reaching out, brainstorming, and working with colleagues.

Skills & Experience Required

Our ideal candidate will have:

  • A bachelor’s degree in English, communications, journalism, public relations, or other related fields
  • 2-4 years’ experience in media relations, specifically creating and distributing content to press
  • Experience building and maintaining relationships with reporters at the local, regional, and national levels
  • Passion for brainstorming, writing, and sending media pitches on a frequent basis
  • Ability to take initiative and proactively suggest PR tactics and ideas
  • Understanding of and appreciation for PR metrics and demonstrating ROI
  • Proven track record of working well within a team environment
  • Knowledge of Vocus/CISION database and Meltwater (a plus)
  • Contacts at national broadcast media outlets (a significant plus)
  • Strong strategic planning, written communication, and verbal communication skills
  • A high level of professional integrity and a strong, honest work ethic
  • A friendly, positive, professional demeanor and personality
  • A detail-oriented and organized approach to work

Other Requirements

  • You must have reliable high-speed Internet access, a fast computer, and phone access.
  • Your work environment must be one in which you can really focus without distractions.

HOW TO APPLY

If this is sounding a lot like you, then please consider applying! What we’ll need from you:

  • An intro email/cover letter telling us:
    • What makes you excited about working for FlexJobs (vs. any other company)
    • One of your favorite PR campaigns that you’ve worked on
    • The most successful PR land that you’ve gotten personally
    • The most important thing you believe you can offer in this role
    • What rate you’d be comfortable with, based on a 40-hour work week
  • A current resume in .doc, .docx, .pdf, or .txt.
  • Applications can be sent by email to jobs@flexjobs.com.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Any applications that don’t include ALL of this information or are a clear half-hearted effort will be put into a “not qualified” group immediately. Sorry to be tough, but we don’t want to waste our time or yours. Hope you understand.

Open to candidates in select US states: CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, IL, MA, ME, MN, NC, NH, NY, OK, OR, PA, TN, TX, VA

Marketing Developer

Company: Podia
Remote

At Podia, we’re building the best platform on the planet for creators to sell online courses, memberships and digital downloads.

We’ve been around for a few years and helped more than 11,000 creators earn millions, and we’re growing fast…

But you’re going to help us grow faster

We’re looking for an A+ developer with serious experience when it comes to working with marketing teams to ship projects that grow the business.

You’ll help us run growth experiments, build better experiences for our prospects and trial users, and continuously improve our marketing funnel from top to bottom.

What you’ll do:

Collaborate closely with marketing and design to ship new campaigns, products, features and updates, including…

  • Implementing changes to our app to improve the user onboarding experience.
  • Building custom apps, pages and websites that support Podia’s marketing goals.
  • Running tests to change behavior, nudging users to complete important in-app tasks.
  • Ensuring that our growth experiments are properly tracked, and owning the technical aspects of tracking and collecting our marketing data.
  • Brainstorming new growth ideas, and then building them.

Technically, you’ve…

  • Used one or more modern web frameworks (Ideally Rails)
  • Built minimum-dependancy Javascript / jQuery widgets
  • Built exceptional app interfaces under the creative direction of a designer
  • Worked with marketing to ship, analyze and optimize growth projects.

Additionally, you…

  • Are comfortable learning new technologies.
  • Are flexible on your technology choices.
  • Are capable of working independently with rapidly changing requirements.
  • Know when to ask for help, and aren’t afraid to do so.
  • Enjoy working on short projects, each potentially different from the next.
  • Know when to move fast, and when to tread carefully (e.g. when you’re working in the app!)
  • Center divs in your sleep
  • Have some experience working remotely. Our team is spread across North America and Europe, and our HQ is Slack. 

Why work at Podia?

  • Ultimate flexibility. We try to have some overlap time every day, but outside of that work whenever & wherever you work best.
  • Extreme autonomy. No micro-managing here. You’ll be given high-level direction and then left to solve it the way you feel is best. You’re the expert!
  • That said, the rest of the team is always ready to lend a hand — or even an ear if you just need to rubber duck some ideas.
  • You get to work with a small, highly-talented team that has built — and continues to build — our business with care. 
  • Whether it’s fixes, small tweaks, or substantial features, we deploy often. There’s zero red tape to slow you down.
  • We have a rapidly growing base of passionate customers, and a much larger market that your projects will be getting in front of. Your work will be seen and appreciated by many people.
  • Competitive compensation. We want to hire the best people, and we’re ready to pay for them.
  • (Paid for) annual retreats to spend time with the team and have fun together. This year’s retreat was in Portland, Maine!

Interested in joining our team?

We’d love to chat

To apply, just fill out this form: https://podia.typeform.com/to/mHCWRq

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: The Movement Athlete; 1-10 employees; 75-100% remote;

If you are up for a challenge of driving growth for a fitness platform while working in a fun, driven remote team and travelling the world- keep on reading.

We are looking for an experienced, entrepreneurial and highly data & results driven marketer to help us take The Movement Athlete global in next 12 months while having the adventure of your life.

About
The Movement Athlete is the world's first platform for skill-based training.

We work with a multidisciplinary team of trainers and coaches, distil their knowledge and turn learning fitness skills into a game. We are starting with calisthenics, gymnastics, acrobatics that include skills like handstands, cartwheels, backflips, human flags easy, fun and safe for everyone.

We have been working on this project for over a year, built an MVP, pre-sold it and validated the market. Last year we spent 3 months in the LeAD Sports Accelerator (run by Adi Dassler family - the founder of Adidas and ex-Red Bull folks). With their backing, we are just finishing the new mobile app with over 160 new moves and we are getting ready to take it globally in the next 12 months.

And that’s where you come in.
YOUR ROLE
We are looking for someone to take ownership of developing and driving marketing strategies specifically on the CONTENT & SOCIAL SIDE.
That which will involve everything from high-level strategy development to hands-on things like managing the content team, building funnels, hiring team, marketing automation, blog and CRM platforms, and use your strong understanding of human needs and behaviours, content marketing to create sustainable growth.


YOU ARE:
-Extremely Data & Analytics Driven but creative with a great eye for a visual and brand.
- You run a comprehensive content and social strategy with positive ROI
-Have experience in leading and growing marketing the team
-Creative and resourceful and you are able to solve problems and come up with ideas on the fly.
-Extremely INDEPENDENT and you take responsibility for creating results. (Once the strategy is determined you will not be micromanaged or have to log your time – it’s all about execution, learning and creating results in the most optimal way)
-DRIVEN BY Personal growth and LEARNING new things
-Fluent or Native English Speaker
- You are passionate about sports and movement training
-Love adventure and want to join a remote team
-Entrepreneurial and looking for an opportunity to join a company early

YOU HAVE DONE:
-Built a lean team to create funnels
-Have hired and managed contractors
-Built a sales funnel

-You have an established exercise routine
-You already work with fully-distributed teams

WHAT’s IN IT FOR YOU?
This is a unique opportunity to come early and together with us build an organisation that not only delivers massive value to our customers but it’s a place we love working in on our own terms.
-Join a fully remote team and have an opportunity to travel the world- (we work from different places in the world, go adventures and meet regularly on team retreats. )
- Take the company globally in next 12-18 months and make an impact in lives of millions of people
-Take your skills to the next level, be challenged and grow as a part of an amazing team of A players
-Join an amazing network of advisors including our early investors including Adidas and Redbull folks.
-Grow together with the company in terms of compensation and rewards

ABOUT THE COMPANY & CULTURE
TMA is a young growing company in a digital fitness space with the team who are extremely growth driven, love adventure, movement as well as the thrill of building projects that can have a global impact. We love our customers and our sole reason for existence is to provide a life-changing experience for them. Not once but for life.
We believe in working hard while having fun, growing, and making a positive impact.

items.title: Marketing Coordinator
items.content:
Marketing Coordinator at SmartBug Media

Remote | Entry-level
  • Sales and Marketing
  • United States

PLEASE READ

You must have hands-on experience with HubSpot to be considered for this position.

Do you love digital marketing and online media? Are you looking to work with really bright people who respect you for your contributions and your character? Do you want to dominate your career without killing your personal life?

If so, you should consider becoming SmartBug Media’s Internal Marketing Coordinator. We’re looking for a responsible, accountable and driven marketer who can help enhance the capabilities of our agency marketing team. You’ll combine your existing skills and a world-class training program into success in an exploding market for inbound marketing, analytics, and marketing automation. You will be challenged every day and you will develop the skills and track record that will make even your mama proud!

We’re building a different kind of work environment at SmartBug Media one where you can deliver great results, have a great time with people you respect and still embrace the things that matter in life. We focus on development and growth.

The Day to Day

You will work hand-in-hand with the Marketing Director, executing our inbound strategy. This means you’ll gain valuable experience in the strategy behind inbound marketing. You’ll work with our marketing consultants, strategists, writers and designers to create and distribute compelling content to our buyer personas. You will quickly become a SmartBug ninja and will spend part of your time ensuring you stay up to speed and learn how to use the newest tools. Technology-wise, you can expect to spend your time using HubSpot, Gaggle, Teamwork (for project management), and other awesome tools like Canva, Sigstr, and Lucky Orange.

Our Commitment

We’re a flat organization and we’re hiring you because you’re smart, driven and want to win just like us. That’s why you’ll have a seat at the table and your ideas heard in making SmartBug Media the most rewarding inbound marketing agency on the planet.

Will your success as an Internal Marketing Coordinator make you our next rock star? We hope so.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Become an expert in inbound marketing tactics including blogging, social media marketing, conversion rate optimization, search engine optimization, e-book/video content creation, website updates, email marketing, webinar and event marketing, and others
  • Become a HubSpot and SmartBug process expert and keep up with software updated and best practices
  • Work with a team of content creators, developers and designers to execute campaign deliverables
  • Take the lead in creating monthly performance reports to highlight wins of campaigns you manage, areas of improvement and recommendations for future programs
  • Stay informed about inbound marketing industry developments
  • Practice your craft by contributing to SmartBug Media’s blog and social media presence
  • Have fun and make some great friends!

Experience and Education Required:

  • 1-3 years experience with online marketing and social media
  • B.A. or B.S. degree
  • Journalism and/or strong writing skills are required
  • Inbound certification or HubSpot certification a plus

Requirements

  • Strong hands-on HubSpot experience
  • Very strong attention to detail and ability to manage projects
  • Strong work ethic with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
  • Demonstrated ability to think creatively
  • Passion for the Internet and marketing with a strong understanding of inbound marketing
  • Demonstrate analytical thinking and independent management skills
  • Strong communicator with excellent customer service and relationship building skills
  • Understanding of major social media platforms
  • Strong writer
  • Basic design skills
  • Basic knowledge of search engine optimization
  • Basic knowledge of email marketing best practices and CAN-SPAM compliance
  • The desire to learn on your own and keep up with inbound marketing and Internet marketing developments and best practices
  • Great writing skills and storytelling skills
  • Proficiency in Google Docs

Our extensive employee benefits program includes:

  • Generous compensation package with performance incentives
  • Health insurance with company contribution
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Paid vacation
  • Paid time off
  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Flexible spend plan
  • Company-funded short-term disability and life insurance
  • Long-term disability
  • Annual leadership conference, SmartBugapalooza’
  • Training budget
  • Flexibility of working remote

CargoMate Technologies is focused on bringing innovative efficiency to the container shipping industry. We are well funded and backed by one of the UK’s most successful tech accelerators, Entrepreneur First.

We’re developing a range of applications and technologies to record, monitor and analyse container ship cargo operations (i.e. the process of moving containers on and off a ship in port), to ensure ships depart early and consume less fuel on a voyage. Our long-term goal is to bring the widespread adoption of autonomous technologies to merchant ships.

We’re looking for an incredibly talented Marketing Manager to join our team and help us take our groundbreaking technology to market.

What you’ll do:

- Build CargoMate’s brand from the ground up, positioning us as a technology leader within container shipping
- Become an expert in container ship operations and the maritime industry
- Take responsibility for creating and delivering CargoMate’s marketing strategy
- Develop a programme of thought leadership including written and video content that adds value for container ship operators worldwide
- Liaise with conference and exhibition companies to manage sponsorship and exhibition opportunities
- Continuously optimise the CargoMate website to grow traffic and marketing qualified leads
- Create, run, and continually optimise CargoMate’s email marketing campaigns to convert and nurture leads
- Manage and grow CargoMate’s social media presence
- Proactively engage with industry and national press to earn coverage for CargoMate and our offering
- Work closely with the Sales team to create campaigns which open up conversations with strategic target accounts
- Create, run, and continually optimise CargoMate’s advertising campaigns

What we want:

- A bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience
- 3 - 5 years experience in marketing, preferably within maritime or technology (or both)
- A practical understanding of inbound marketing and experience creating inbound campaigns focused on high quality written and video content
- An obsession with creating a great prospect experience and opening the door for conversations with members of our sales team
- Outstanding communication, interpersonal skills, and organisational skills, you should be a great writer, speaker, and listener
- Experience running and managing websites (we use Wordpress), setting up landing pages, and optimising them for conversions
- Experience of email marketing, PPC campaigns, and remarketing
- Experience working with Hubspot (our CRM and marketing system), or the willingness to quickly learn how to get the most out of it
- Flexibility - we’re constantly changing and evolving as a team and we want people who are willing to evolve with us
- The ability to challenge the status quo and continuously improve the way we work
- The ability to travel internationally and the desire to market to an international client base
- The intelligence to quickly become an expert in maritime operations, our technology, and marketing best practices; and the curiosity to continuously learn about the space as it develops.

What you’ll get:

- A competitive salary plus performance related bonus
- Support, mentoring, and the tools you need to become world class at what you do
- The chance to join an early stage business and shape its future
- A structured path to promotion, with the opportunity to lead a team as we scale
- The flexibility to work when you want to, and opportunity to undertake remote work once you’ve completed your first few months on the team

items.title: Product Manager
items.content:
Product Manager

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: Packlane
Full Time

Overview

We are looking for an exceptional Product Manager who is passionate about building products that our customers and staff love. You will join a dynamic, fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy. Best of all, you’ll do this remotely.

Meet Packlane

Packlane empowers brands big and small to create beautiful, affordable unboxing experiences that customers will enjoy and remember. From subscription boxes to event swag, eye-catching packaging can help brands connect with their customers – so we do everything we can to make it a smooth and easy process. Our services are trusted by over 10,000 companies including Google, L’Oreal, Shopify, Red Bull and more.

We’re a team of eager self-starters from all over the world, and we’re looking for others to help grow Packlane into the best company it can be. Our core values are creativity (including beautiful design!), high quality work, and a passion for what we do. If that sounds like a good fit, we can’t wait to hear from you!

Responsibilities
  • Gain a deep understanding of customer and staff experience, identify and fill product and tooling gaps and generate new ideas that and drive growth and improve our internal efficiency
  • Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
  • Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes
  • Coordinate with executive team to execute the roadmap
  • Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact
  • Work closely with engineers and other stakeholders to deliver products with quick time-to-market and just the right amount of effort
  • Drive product launches including working with public relations team, executives, and other product management team members

    • Requirements
    • Work experience leading and coordinating interdisciplinary groups
    • Successful track record of managing complex projects with dependencies on internal and external resources and timelines
    • Proven ability to develop product strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management
    • Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
    • Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job

items.title: Sr Route Optimization Engineer
items.content:
Sr Route Optimization Engineer

Company: Clevertech

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces. 

REQUIREMENTS

* You love doing puzzles 
* You have serious math skills
* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

BENEFITS 

Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travelers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.  

Recharge Time
We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself
You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work
You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. 

Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.
And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag
And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over Slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team?  Check out: http://clevertech.careers

items.title: Google Search Evaluator (Remote, Work-from-home)
items.content:
Search evaluators (aka search engine evaluators, web search evaluators, internet assessors, search quality raters) provide educated feedback for search engines. The core of the job is to rate the relevance of search results based on a user's search query. Their feedback is used to test improvements on search engines' algorithms.

The job is 100% telecommute (work from home). People from all backgrounds are welcome. Hiring process is outsourced by Google to external vendors who are responsible for the application and qualification process.

Pay rate: $13.50/hour

Product Owner

Company: Novate IT Ltd
Location: Cwmbran
Permanent

Product Owner - iOS , Android - Cwmbran

A brand new role with a highly successful and growing employer in South Wales for a Product Owner to work across a variety of video - centric projects for their platform. A generous starting salary is offered plus benefits such as up to 10% bonus, flexi time, a 25 day holiday allowance that will increase with service, life assurance, 3% employee 6% employer initial pension package and private health care.

The company have several applications that are used by consumers on a global scale across both mobile and web platforms, these applications handle huge amounts of data with no downtime or stress on their systems. They are now looking to hire a Product Owner to help drive product development with local and remote scrum teams.

You will have experience of working in an Agile environment helping local and remote teams of cross-functional developers understand user stories and promote the company's product vision. You will be working on iOS and Android projects so you must have knowledge of both. You will also be able to balance utilising good functionality, user experience and product design. On the technical side solid experience of understanding test automation, continuous integration and deployment as well as evaluating current engineering standards and suggesting improvements is essential. items.content:
B2C SaaS Growth Marketing – Digital Marketing Generalist – N or S America

Company: Custody X Change
Headquarters: Utah, USA
https://www.custodyxchange.com
I'm hiring someone as a one-person marketing department to help grow my B2C SaaS business. We have a lot of low-hanging fruit, and I hope you can achieve great results. Previous experience with growth marketing in a B2C SaaS environment is preferred.

This is a great time for you to apply your skills because we are going through a business and product transition. We are transitioning away from selling downloadable software as a one-time purchase, to selling an online web-app as a subscription. This involves completely changing our customer journey and sales focus, and we need your help!

Your role includes:
  • Increasing renewal rates on our new SaaS B2C web-app
  • Customer success to help with onboarding, usability, and marketing
  • Conversion rate optimization
  • Using data and analytics to find opportunities
  • Marketing creatives: text, images, videos
  • Sales to professionals
  • Growing the business using other methods of your own initiative
  • Measuring the success of your tasks

Your role does NOT include:
  • Social media marketing of any kind (social media is useless for our business)
  • SEO / PPC (these roles are taken care of other people)

I'd like to hire you if you:
  • Have experience in growth marketing in a B2C SaaS environment
  • Look for opportunities instead of simply being told what to do
  • Speak fluent English, though you can live anywhere in North or South America
  • Want to work from home in a long-term position
  • And we get along; to see the team you'll be joining, visit our about us page

My company is called Custody X Change. I've been working on the business since 2004. We sell a web application that creates child custody schedules and parenting plans. It also helps families make difficult decisions post-divorce/separation, and facilities communication between two parents who may not get along very well anymore. All of this reduces a lot of conflict and saves people a ton of money in legal fees.

If you want to grow a genuinely helpful product, and join a small, distributed team, then we should talk.

To apply, email me at careers@custodyxchange.com, and:
  • Include your resume in PDF format
  • Somehow use the word "grape" in the subject of your email
  • Answer the following questions in your email, in this order. For questions 2-7, 100+ word answers preferred, and attach screenshots if applicable. If you haven't used a tactic before, simply say so. As social media and SEO aren't part of this role, please don't use those as examples, if you have other examples to share.
  1. Where do you live?
  2. How have you increased renewal rates for a B2C SaaS product?
  3. How have you used customer success/support/experience to grow a business?
  4. How have you used conversion rate optimization principles successfully?
  5. How have you used data and analytics to grow a business?
  6. What's a marketing creative (text / image / video) that you created that did particularly well?
  7. What's another way you grew a business?
  8. How many hours per week do you want to work, and what would you be happy earning, in this long-term, remote position?

Note: agencies need not apply; I'm looking for an employee or contractor to join our team.

Thanks,
-Ben

P.S. I want you to be happy working for me. I'll pay you a good salary and you can work normal hours. I care about results, not bureaucracy.

Apply for this position

items.title: SEO Sales Executive
items.content:
*About Us*

Design Your Way LTD is a very small, recently started company that is based upon digital marketing and lead generation. Specifically, our main speciality are high ticket items in Building and Construction projects, but we also operate with smaller industries also. We have a small amount of websites generating leads, however the average value of each lead for the larger assets between £15,000 - £200,000 dependent on project, making the potential profits larger than anticipated. We are now looking to extend the SEO branch of our company, and looking to hire a full time sales executive to outreach for SEO clients.

*Job Description*

We are looking for an experienced, extremely confident and innovative SEO Sales Executive who can both prospect and sell SEO services to companies in local areas around the United Kingdom. Many of the clients we are aiming for will be local to either borough (London) or city, and the niches will be discussed. We will also need someone who is capable of working from home, as we do not work within an office.

The right salesman will be able to prospect all potential and future clients, while offering a clients a monthly payment scheme. The candidate will also be able to ensure that all relationships will grow and maintain throughout time, with hopefully some room for negotiation upon cost in the future, however this is not a necessity. Finally, the right candidate will be able to keep in communication with clients during their active status with us. We are not offering a salary for this role, but we are offering 20% of all profits from the organisation. We are also offering the chance to work remotely.

This is both ideal for recent graduates looking to gain industry experience in SEO and sales for an independent business based in the heart of London, but equally suited to someone with precious sales experience and prefers working on a freelance basis”

*Responsibilities*

* Prospect, identify and secure new SEO Clients.
* Maintain and grow relationships between us and SEO clients.
* Negotiate a contract between us and clients that are beneficial for both.
* Able to report all improvements in website rank in keywords, loading times and other significant ranking factors.
* Able to work 2 - 3 days a week.
* Have a clear and concise strategy to secure clients within a suitable time frame.

*Skills & Knowledge*

* Experience outreaching for and acquiring SEO clients.
* Confidence approaching businesses via calls, e-mail and face to face if necessary.
* Self-motivating and passion for SEO sales.
* Disciplined and targeted sales approach.
* Desire to exceed beyond expectations.
* Confident to reflect and adapt sales approaches both through phone and e-mail.

*Benefits*

* 20% of all profits, 25% based on performance and speed of client acquisition.
* Working from home.
* Small amount of total clients needed (10 to begin) means very small workload.
* Flexible working hours.
* Opportunity to stay on during future expansion on an improved deal based on performance.

PPC, Paid Search Advertising Specialist at CanIRank

Remote | Entry-level | International | Part-time

THE OPPORTUNITY

Are you a talented PPC / Paid Search Specialist looking for an opportunity to accelerate your career growth?

How about helping to craft new processes and shape the M.O. of a brand new Paid Advertising team that you might one day lead?

Oh yeah, and doing it all within a fast-growing, 100% distributed digital marketing agency with a unique model that combines the best of machine learning-based software and a team of whip-smart digital marketing specialists?

If this sounds like the challenge you’re looking for, we’d love to have you apply for our new PPC Specialist role!

This is a remote work, flex-time position starting at $16-25/hr with hours ranging from 20-40 hrs/ week. Additional benefits include paid training, a learning stipend, technology stipend, performance bonuses, and the opportunity to work with some pretty badass digital marketers! Ideal candidates should have full-time or near full-time availability, and are looking to grow with the company long-term as they rise through the ranks of a digital marketing agency.

ABOUT YOU

  • 1-5 years professional work experience including management of AdWords campaigns in the $1k – $20k / month budget range
  • AdWords Certification because we love badges
  • Knowledge of copywriting best practices so you can squeeze Shakespeare’s eloquence, Oscar Wilde’s wit, and Kanye’s creativity into 60 characters
  • Startup compatibility: you’re comfortable with changing roles, blistering speed, and figuring it out as you go along
  • Passion for helping small businesses succeed. We genuinely care about helping our clients succeed, and you should to
  • Self-disciplined: you prefer to structure your own tasks, all the better to try out that new hyper-productivity system you read about last weekend

OPTIONAL, BUT NICE TO HAVE

  • Prior client relations experience in an agency or consulting setting
  • Success in a remote role
  • Experience with other paid ad channels
  • Experience building out and managing a new team (which would probably qualify you for a higher-end position than this – ask us about that option)

To apply, please fill out the application here: https://goo.gl/forms/DINDIMHTahEVDGXf1

ABOUT US

Our company Open Development, Inc. is a fast-growing startup offering a unique “software+service” model to help startups and SMEs improve the performance of their website with greater effectiveness and lower cost than a traditional marketing agency. You can think of our software side as something like Siri for your website, or “an online marketing expert in a box”, offered through partners like domain registrars and web hosts, as well as through our own brands CanIRank and Growth AI. Our Full Service marketing agency half is like “Uber for online marketing”, with a distributed team of online marketing professionals working together on the opportunities identified by the software.

By combining the power of machine learning and a specialized on-demand workforce, we help SMEs compete with the mega-corporations like Amazon and Walmart, and prevent the web from turning into just another Big Brand strip mall.

A few things that make us unique as a company:

  • Founded by an experienced entrepreneur who has worked at 7 startups in 3 countries, including one $200M+ exit
  • Our core technology was developed by a team of 3 Stanford engineers, with help from one of the world’s leading predictive analytics experts
  • We reward great work with “thank you” gifts that have included a Kindle, speakers, a trip to Paris, an espresso machine, and sailing trips
  • We’re a distributed team with contributors from San Francisco, Seattle, Quebec, Cordoba, and elsewhere. Never has meeting your coworkers been this much fun!
  • We believe a healthy employee is a productive one, and that means taking time away from the computer to cultivate other interests, which for us range from rock climbing to organic farming to game design
  • A supportive company culture focused on helping each other become better at what we do, both informally (celebrating successes, pooling expertise, sharing good reads, etc) and formally (6-week paid training period, mentoring & feedback from experienced marketers, budget for continuing education)

items.title: Senior Product Manager
items.content:
Senior Product Manager at SocialChorus

Remote

Remote – US

Product & Engineering

Full-time

The modern workplace is changing. It seems strange but in a world of connected everything, employees are feeling more disconnected than ever. Want to fix that? SocialChorus is on a mission to transform how workers and organizations stay connected every day. We believe everyone matters. Our goal is to have every employee informed, supported, and connected. The intranet and email are broken for organization communications.

How do we fix it? With a workforce communications platform that delivers personalized relevant content in engaging fashion. We streamline and scale the enterprise workflow. We provide an open platform to simplify the complex common in the world’s largest companies.

Has it worked? Absolutely! Our client list includes household names and is growing daily, and now we need your help! We are currently seeking a Senior Product Manager to help deliver the next generation of our SaaS communication platform solutions.

We are a distributed team. While we have offices in several cities, we build solutions for distributed workforces, so we model our own workforce the same way. In this role you really can work where you want.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Own the full execution of the product development process as it aligns with the product strategy
  • Understand success metrics and incorporate data into design and development process
  • Perform customer research and competitive analysis in order to develop business cases and make effective product decisions
  • Work closely with the Client Support team and the development team to identify and follow up on client concerns, feedback, and follow up on status
  • Engage internal and external customers to understand their needs and gather product requirements
  • Help drive our data-driven culture: Accumulate, analyze, present, and leverage data in decision making, and look for opportunities to cultivate richer insights about our products
  • Provide leadership and mentorship to members of the product management team
  • Not only practice but also help manage and refine our product life cycle

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s Degree in a related business or technical field, or equivalent experience
  • 7+ years of experience in product management, preferably in a B2B, SaaS environment
  • Hallmarks: leadership, creativity, teamwork, and strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work independently to a high degree, and direct a cross-functional team designing, delivering, and maintaining new and enhanced functionality and integrations
  • Solid technical knowledge, in particular experience with API’s and other B2B integration platforms, is helpful but not required for this position
  • Knowledge of and familiarity with not only product management, but also production support, software development, user experience, marketing, and sales
  • Tolerance for the challenge of a fast-paced, sometimes chaotic startup environment is a must!
  • Experience beyond the core product management skill set is a plus, especially product strategy, but also product marketing, resource management, forecasting, and budgeting
  • SCRUM/JIRA Experience: since we don’t have project managers or SCRUM masters, those functions are distributed on our project teams; our product managers share some Agile project management responsibilities with engineering leads, including JIRA management

Why SocialChorus? Because you care. About people, the work you do, and the connections you make. Work is such a large part of life, it only makes sense to make it awesome.

If you want to engage brilliant minds in a true startup environment where ideas are rewarded regardless of who they come from, join us. This is a rapidly changing space, so if you thrive on ambiguity, are hungry for a challenge, and have the guts to speak your mind it could be a perfect fit. So come for the challenges, come for the people… and come for the unlimited PTO, health benefits, 401k plan, casual and friendly environment, and a leadership team who truly believes in your growth both professionally and personally.

items.title: Content Marketer
items.content:
Content Marketer at Bigscreen

Remote | Freelance | International

REMOTE

MARKETING

FULL-TIME

Bigscreen is one of the most popular and widely used VR apps in the world. Use cases of Bigscreen include playing your fav Steam games in VR, watching movies in a virtual theater with friends, and even working and collaborating with colleagues in a virtual office.

We’re looking for a hungry, scrappy & talented person to take charge of marketing and PR at Bigscreen. Your job is to communicate the value proposition of Bigscreen – “what, why, and how” – to the world.

You’ll also be responsible for content marketing, social media, coordinating press coverage for product launches. Content marketing work includes writing blog posts and creating visual (screenshot/GIF/video) content to explain and promote use cases of Bigscreen. You’ll get to work remotely, a budget to buy and play videogames, write compelling blog posts, create engaging content for YouTube and Twitter, and build the Bigscreen brand.

About Bigscreen

Founded in 2014, Bigscreen is a California-based technology company creating an immersive virtual reality telepresence platform that aims to revolutionize the way people work, play, hangout, and collaborate. Since its beta launch in March 2016, it has become one of the most popular and highly rated VR apps. Power users spend 20-30 hours per week in Bigscreen, making it one of the most widely used “killer apps” in the industry.

Join us and help design the future of computing and collaboration.

Requirements

  • Strong writing skills with prior published work in blogs or news sites
  • Strong understanding of VR and AR
  • Familiarity with a wide range of gaming genres and popular PC/console games
  • Good communication skills in English
  • Experience working independently and remotely
  • Experience using Bigscreen
  • Must own a Vive or Rift
  • Must enjoy playing PC & console videogames

Bonus Skills

  • Design and photo editing skills with Adobe Photoshop (or similar)
  • Video production and editing skills, specifically video game trailers
  • Experience with video editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar)
  • Experience with making VR videos using green screens (mixed reality)

Responsibilities

  • Content marketing (writing blog posts & help center docs, capturing & editing videos, GIFs, and screenshots)
  • Improve user acquisition and retention by effectively communicating Bigscreen’s value propositions and use cases to new users
  • Press outreach (pitch journalists and secure coverage for major product launches and announcements)

Please send us examples of published work, blog posts, game reviews, YouTube videos, and other content you’ve created.

Location is remote.

Once hired, you’ll have access to any hardware you need ranging from the latest VR headsets to PCs, gaming consoles, as well as a budget to buy and play the latest games and movies.

This can be a part-time/freelance or a full-time position. Like all positions at Bigscreen, this job will start out as a 2-8 week paid contract (a trial period). If that works out well, we can discuss a full-time role.

Job description

Why Carbon Black?

At Carbon Black, you’ll have the chance to make an impact in the ever-evolving cybersecurity space. Our advanced technology tackles even the toughest challenges and stays ahead of the latest threats.

If you want to join an agile company that’s building bleeding edge technology in the cloud, Carbon Black is the place for you. Driven by passionate people who are dedicated to making the world safer, it’s no wonder we’ve been named a “Top Place to Work” by the Boston Globe for four consecutive years. Join us!.

Why You Matter

Carbon Black, the leader in advanced threat protection, is seeking a Senior Threat Engineer. This is a senior level position targeted toward individuals with more than 10 years of experience in software development.  

Experience in software development, debugging, and testing - including in languages such as C++, C, python, assembly, and shell scripting is required.  Understanding of modern defensive and offensive security tools, techniques and methods is also required. Educational and personal experience with network/systems administration and/or information security related work is necessary.

Senior Threat Engineers at Carbon Black are responsible for leading, conducting and presenting threat research done by the Threat Analysis Unit (TAU) and building systems used across our security program.  This includes the strong understanding of endpoint detection, cloud technologies, security operations, current threatscape and emerging threats. Senior Threat Engineers will participate in the design, development, and deployment of tools to assist in threat research and security frameworks utilized by our products.  Senior Threat Engineers are also expected to provide mentorship to other members of the team, and take lead in maturing procedures, evaluating new security technologies, incident response, penetration testing, and prototype/experiment with new ideas and technologies to improve both our product and services.

What You’ll Do

  • Actively work on current software development projects related to product enhancements and efficacy.  Create new software tools for internal research and development.
  • Design and implement software proof of concepts for emerging malware technique detections.
  • Performs security research, reverse engineer malware, handle complex security events, and analyze incident response, and coordinating with other teams.
  • Work closely with internal and external customers for product and service improvements.
  • Take ownership or support ongoing projects by assisting in the implementation, research, testing and documentation of security related projects.
  • Maintain knowledge of emerging security technologies and discipline developments. Research and manage the implementation of new technologies to enhance our products and customers’ security postures.
  • Actively participate in the Carbon Black User-Exchange community as a subject matter expert, presenting in forums, online and at conferences.

Technical Skills / Experience:

  • Experience with a number of the following is a requirement: C, C++, x86/x64 assembly, Python, Unix Shell scripts, Powershell
  • Experience in participating in medium and large scale software development projects - from initial conception and design to final deployment.
  • Experience with Java or C# is a plus
  • Windows operating system internals (registry, APIs, kernel operations, forensic artifacts)
  • Windows development of user mode applications using Visual Studio.  Kernel development experience is a plus. Development on other platforms other than Windows is also a plus.
  • Ability to translate descriptions of attacks or malware techniques into proof of concept demonstrations for testing and product improvement.

What You’ll Bring

  • Windows or other operating system internals experience
  • Knowledge of x86 and x64 instruction set architectures
  • Knowledge of user and kernel level debuggers and static analysis applications such as WinDbg, OllyDbg, x64dbg, Binary Ninja, or IDA Pro
  • Ability to analyze malware, determine TTPs (tactics, techniques, and procedures) unique to threat actors, and extract indicators to feed back into the products
  • Strong interpersonal skills, ability to mentor/train staff and bring awareness to current and emerging threats
  • Certifications preferred: CISSP, OSCP/OSCE, SANS GIAC Certifications (GREM, GCFA, GCFE)
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills with an ability to present technical risks and issues to non-technical audiences
Apply now

About Carbon Black

Who We Are
Carbon Black is a leading provider of next-generation endpoint security. Carbon Black serves more than 3,700 customers globally, including 33 of the Fortune 100. As a cybersecurity innovator, Carbon Black has pioneered multiple endpoint security categories, including application control, endpoint detection and response (EDR), and next-generation antivirus (NGAV). Leveraging its big data and analytics cloud platform – the Cb Predictive Security Cloud – Carbon Black solutions enable customers to defend against the most advanced cyber threats, including malware, ransomware, and non-malware attacks. Deployed via the cloud, on premise, or as a managed service, customers use Carbon Black solutions to lock down critical systems, hunt threats, and replace legacy antivirus.

Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company.

Benefits

  • Flexible vacation
  • Remote/Work-from-home options
  • Medical/Dental/Vision
  • Stand-up desks and unique workspaces
  • Free snacks/drinks, Happy Hours, and regular catering
  • Care.com access and pet insurance
  • On-site gym
  • Career development programs
  • Lounge/game room
  • Competitive salaries, 401k, and stock options

About the Role

We’re a small, growing company looking to up our email marketing game from “haphazard startup” to “well-oiled machine”. We’re Crossword Hobbyist (https://crosswordhobbyist.com) and My Word Search (https://mywordsearch.com), the absolute best way to make crosswords and word searches online. We’re the best because “delight the customer” isn’t just a motto for us: it’s why we exist. And incredible email communication is essential to meeting that mission.

We’re looking for an experienced email marketer who can take ownership of all aspects of email marketing, from onboarding emails that are personalized based on customer behavior to launching 1-2 newsletters for >500k recipients on two brands.

The position will begin with a one week, 40-hr trial contract focused on personalized emails. The trial period is designed to make sure we enjoy working with each other and that it’s a great fit for both of us.

After the trial period, you’ll get responsibility for launching the newsletter and managing the personalized customer emails on an ongoing, part-time basis. The exact number of hours is negotiable.

Your Qualifications

  • 2+ years as an email marketing specialist
  • Strong understanding of all key email marketing metrics
  • Strong understanding of customer behavior
  • You get anxious when you don’t have multiple A/B tests running
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Proven experience working remotely preferred

  • Commitment to an honest, kind work environment
  • Flexible work hours
  • All-remote work environment that doesn’t value remote work less than in-office work (since we have no office)
  • No office politics or middle management: report to the CEO

Lead Product Manager


Manifold

 verified

Manifold is helping developers break free from the closed ecosystems of the cloud and into a more open, standards based community of services and APIs. Our marketplace connects applications, wherever they are hosted, to independent cloud services made by developers who care. Read more about our vision and funding here and check out our blog.

We are looking for a collaborative and highly technical lead product manager, with previous growth or startup experience. You will help us develop a rapid, iterative product cycle that uses customer development, experiments, data, and well-tuned intuition to build our product and our roadmap. You have creativity, rigor, confidence, and humility.

We believe that you'll love to work with the intelligent, kind, productive, and inspiring people who would be your colleagues. Many of us have strong ties to the open-source world, and have experience building tools at companies like Heroku, Red Hat, and Canonical.

Our first choice is that you work in our San Francisco office, but you can also join the half of us who work remotely within a few time zones of US Eastern, or the fine people in our home office in Halifax, Canada. We value diversity, equal opportunity, and supporting a remote-reliant distributed culture. Gender diversity is currently about one fifth.


What you'll do


* Connect directly with customers throughout the product development lifecycle. Participate in customer development, user research, user testing, and customer support.

* Collaborate deeply with fellow product managers, designers, engineers, marketing, and the executive team.

* Hypothesize, experiment, gather data, interpret, and act.

* Facilitate building our product vision and roadmaps, with alignment and enthusiasm from the team. Help make tough prioritization decisions, based on well-supported and well-reasoned rationales. Adjust dynamically based on new information.

* Communicate progress, changes, and setbacks clearly.

* Help lead a friendly, open culture that encourages us to support one another, challenge one another, and grow stronger together.

* Be a model and mentor for our other product managers.

* Be passionate about our mission, advocate for us, and help us envision Manifold's future.

* Be curious. Learn, practice, share, and improve our knowledge, tools, and processes.





What you'll need


* Deep empathy and respect for others, both customers and peers; combined with a backbone, intuition, and clearly reasoned opinions.

* Strong communication skills, with a team-centric and remote-reliant approach to discussion and decision-making that intelligently balances asynchronous and synchronous messaging.

* Strong technical ability. Ideally, some or all of the following describes you: you are proficient in one or more programming languages; you have experience and opinions about authorization systems; you like working in the terminal; or you are comfortable with modern development and deployment standards like Git, Docker, and Kubernetes.

* Strong analytical abilities, with experience in SQL, A/B and multivariate tests, metrics, and statistics.

* A real passion for design, usability, and detail.

* Deep and broad knowledge of the cloud developer tools space, or an ability to gain it quickly.

* Experience working with a distributed team, or an interest in learning.

* 5+ years of product management or equivalent experience.

* Nice to have: experience with marketplaces and/or SaaS products.





We're looking for


* Empathy

* Mentoring

* Product Management

* SQL

* Customer Development





A little bit about us

At Manifold, we help developers discover and use innovative tools and technologies; so you can focus on building, not managing, your applications. Each new cloud service we use today introduces complexity in the form of another bill, account to manage, credential to secure, and code to deploy.

Manifold allows you to build and offer cloud services to developers without having to worry about billing, identity, and credential distribution (An example of one such service: JawsDB).

We're a small, remote-reliant venture-backed company based in Halifax, Canada with an office in San Francisco. With a shared passion for making developers lives easier and our backgrounds reflect that, having worked at the likes of Red Hat, Heroku, Canonical, and Salesforce.


Are you interested?

We offer competitive compensation, equity opportunities, and excellent health care options, with additional perks such as a yearly professional development allowance. Please apply here, or by emailing gary@manifold.co.

items.content:
Digital Campaign Strategist at Rainforest Action Network

Remote

Rainforest Action Network (RAN) is an environmental and human rights organization that believes individuals and communities can confront corporate power together to create the world we want and need. RAN uses nonviolent direct action, grassroots organizing, and strategic communications to challenge corporations to stop destructive operations, respect human rights, and adopt comprehensive policies to reduce their contributions to climate change. We take leadership from grassroots and Indigenous movements and are currently developing our organization-wide racial justice lens.

RAN’s Forest Program fights for the health of the world’s rainforests, and the people and species which rely on them for survival. We stand up to the biggest corporations in the world, the companies putting profits over people and the planet as a matter of business. When human rights are abused, when child and forced labor is an everyday tactic, where land is stolen from Indigenous Peoples so multi-national mega-corporations can destroy forests with impunity, we’ll be there fighting the root causes of deforestation.

RAN believes that people acting together can change this, as we have seen time and again throughout history.

Position Summary:

RAN has an opening for a full-time position on our Digital Engagement Team for a Digital Campaign Strategist for the Forest Program. If you want to make a difference for the environment and human rights, you’re creative and have strong digital and writing skills, this could be the perfect role for you. The Digital Campaign Strategist will work closely with RAN’s Forests Program to provide the digital strategy and technical backbone necessary for effective online campaigning. The successful candidate will know how to utilize digital channels to compel online and offline action. They will be experienced and strategic in leveraging both in-house resources such as our email list and advocacy platform, NationBuilder (or have equivalent eCRM experience), as well as social media to leverage people power and provide concrete results for the campaign. The Digital Campaign Strategist will plan and implement a range of digital strategies and tactics, some tried-and-true and some innovative. The Digital Campaign Strategist will be responsible for evaluating data, testing, and reporting back on insights and knowledge gained from each online action completed. In addition to the utilization of online assets in strong and effective campaigning and fundraising, the Digital Campaign Strategist will be responsible for assisting with growth of RAN’s presence across social media channels. The ideal candidate will have strong writing skillsfor example, they will be able to craft an excellent advocacy email, write an engaging blog and create effective social media copy. Applicants with a background in organizing, campaigning, and/or strategic communications will be a better fit for this position than those with purely technical backgrounds.

This position is full-time, salary with excellent benefits and reports directly to the Digital Director. This location is flexible, San Francisco preferred. A successful applicant outside of San Francisco must be comfortable and effective working in a distributed team from a home office. With our headquarters located in San Francisco, remote applicants must be comfortable working on or near San Francisco time during normal working hours.

Specific Duties:

  • Working with campaigners, the Digital Campaign Strategist will plan and execute all aspects of robust campaigns in the digital space to move corporate targets.
  • Write and produce email blasts, blogs, social media content, and other written materials for online production.
  • Build, test, and deploy online action, fundraising and landing pages.
  • Create and test emails and other online communications.
  • Use online tools such as Share Progress, Brigade, Causes, and MoveOn Petitions to increase reach and growth for RAN’s campaigns.
  • Create advocacy and donation forms and surveys using NationBuilder or similar eCRM platform.
  • Use Google Analytics, eCRM, Facebook Insights, and other data reporting tools to track and share data analytics and strategically adapt campaign tactics.
  • Provide analysis of online performance and recommendations for changes when needed.
  • Manage followers on social media and implement strategies to grow reach.
  • Create content highlighting regions impacted by deforestation and/or climate change.
  • Support other aspects of RAN’s work (e.g. helping during major fundraising events, grassroots trainings, or campaigns priorities as requested by supervisor);
  • Work openly and cooperatively within a high functioning team dynamic;
  • Participate in weekly team meetings and bi-weekly RAN staff meetings;
  • Share office responsibilities to maintain a healthy and safe workplace.

Required Qualifications:

  • 2-3 years of experience using online advocacy tools such as NationBuilder, Blue State Digital, Action Kit, Salsa, Convio, etc;
  • 2-3 years of experience writing advocacy content for online use;
  • Strong interpersonal skills;
  • Strong organizational, time management and project management skills, ability to work to tight deadlines;
  • Passionate commitment to forests protection, human rights and/or corporate campaigning;
  • Basic understanding of HTML;
  • Experience using social media, such as Twitter and Facebook, for campaigning;
  • Experience using basic reporting tools to analyze and track data;
  • Ability to work independently from a remote location, to follow instructions, and complete tasks across time zones with a minimal amount of supervision if necessary;
  • Strong commitment to and belief in the power of using online resources to help empower communities and activists;
  • Knowledge and commitment to advancing racial justice;

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience as an organizer or campaigner with an advocacy non-profit;
  • Experience using A/B testing in an advocacy or marketing capacity.

RAN strives to integrate values of equity and fairness into our work, which includes bringing an intentional racial justice analysis to our programmatic work and organizational structure. We are seeking candidates who have a commitment to engage in this ongoing process and work with us to create a just and inclusive work environment and world. RAN provides all people with equal employment and volunteer opportunities while also staying committed to providing accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. We encourage applicants of color to apply for this position.

COMPENSATION

The salary for this position is competitive for the small non-profit San Francisco Bay Area market, with a range of $53,000 – $58,000 depending on experience. Benefits include full health coverage for the employee and their partner/family (plus an employer funded HSA), VSP & dental insurance, 4 weeks PTO (increases to 5 weeks after 2 years), and a Simple IRA retirement plan with a 3% fully vesting employer match. Additionally, after 5 years, staff are eligible for a 3 month fully paid sabbatical.

Job Description

What we’re looking for:

- A leader who is comfortable operating across all Marketing Channels, Branding and PR, but whose true expertise resides in Digital and Performance Marketing.
- A strategic thinker who also possesses a strong appetite for detail and is not afraid to get very tactical to drive effective execution.
- A strong people manager who has a passion to hire, grow, and develop great marketing talent.
- An intellectually curious leader who possesses a deep commitment to driving constant levels of marketing innovation.
- A highly collaborative leader who is committed to building strong working relationships with cross-functional business partners, and operates with a “team first” mindset at all times.

Responsibilities:

Executive Leadership

Be a role model for leadership: take an active part in mentoring and developing people and exhibiting strong proficiency in collaboration, building teams, and driving strong performance in a high-trust environment.

Serve as an integral member of the leadership team, assisting in the development and implementation of strategic direction.

Partner with the leadership team to analyze industry trends and competitive landscape to help develop, refine, and implement a holistic corporate brand, employer brand, and go-to-market strategy.

Marketing Strategy Leadership

- Establish a deep understanding of market and customer trends and cascade this learning across the Townsquared organization.
- Oversee the development and ongoing evolution of Breezy Marketing strategy, including:
* Overall Channel Mix Strategy
* Digital & Growth Channel Strategy
* Brand & Public Relations Strategy
* Community & Events Marketing Strategy (Proactive and Reactive)
* Establish overall and channel specific marketing metric benchmarks and targets

Operational Leadership

- Oversee the development of detailed operating plans that are designed to translate the Marketing Strategy (overall and channel specific) into actionable go-to-market plans, and establish robust measurement methodologies to ensure effective channel optimization at all times.
- Manage Brand Strategy efforts, and ensure 100% Brand alignment across the end-to-end Townsquared experience at all times.
- Scale a high performing Marketing Organization to ensure that we can deliver on all strategic and operational objectives.
- Ensure that all necessary Marketing Solutions and Infrastructure are in place at all times.
- Partner with Analytics Team to develop Marketing Dashboards that are designed to help manage the Marketing Function like a business.
- Partner with Product team to optimize the Landing Experience and Sign-Up flow.
- Stay ahead of the curve as it relates to understanding and exploring emerging marketing channels and solutions.

Experience:

- 3+ years of experience in a high growth, technology-centric company.
- Track record of delivering sustained levels of marketing innovation by identifying, prioritizing, and driving execution of new profitable growth opportunities.

Marketing Channel experience

- Experience managing legacy digital marketing channels (i.e. Google SEM and SEO) and emerging marketing channels (i.e. Paid Social).
- Some experience managing or working closely with Brand Marketing and Public Relations functions (but deep hands-on experience not required).
- Experience deploying and managing Marketing Automation & Analytics Solutions and Infrastructure.
- Experience building and scaling a high-performing team (even if team size was relatively small).

Nice to have:
- Experience working within a SaaS company in a marketing role
- HR and/or recruiting knowledge / experience

Why work with us:

- Help shape our product and company culture
- Fully paid medical you and your family
- Flexible vacation and holidays
- Equity in a fast growing startup in one of the hottest SaaS markets

Analytics & Reporting, Product Marketing, Sales and Marketing, Content Marketing, Digital Marketing, Google Adwords

items.content:
Public Relations Director

Various
Anywhere in US
Company: The Humane League
Full Time

Overview

The Humane League is an international farm animal advocacy group. At The Humane League, we foster a high-energy culture of teamwork and mission-driven problem solving, and we have earned recognition as Top Charity from Animal Charity Evaluators for all of their rating periods. Over the past few years, The Humane League has strategically positioned itself for growth. We are currently a team of 70+ committed individuals, dispersed across the country and the world. We are looking for a PR Director to bring our mission, campaigns and meaningful stories to major media and influencers, for high-impact exposure and relationship development on behalf of our organization and the animals we work for every day.

YOUR OPPORTUNITY

Your position plays an integral role in building The Humane League’s credibility and exposing our mission, our movement and our work to media and influencers—those who reach and impact millions of people.

We want you because you have a mission and values-centered approach to your life and your work. You are ideal for this position because you have a rich background of experience in Communications and/or PR and media relations, with a proven track record in securing highly visible feature stories in leading national and international media outlets and local publications. Critically, you possess persuasive written and verbal communications skills, an active network of applicable media and influencer contacts, and a can do, relentless and inherently positive attitude.

This is a full-time, remote position with a preference for candidates in NY & LA, along with occasional travel.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Build, implement and lead our PR strategy, focused on securing prominent exposure with local, national and international media outlets and with key influencers.
  • Coordinate all PR activities, including: crafting and disseminating big creative media pitches, 1:1 outreach and press releases.
  • Lead media/influencer events, from start-to-finish, as needed, in-line with our agreed upon strategy.
  • Create and manage our target media and influencer lists, including those in mainstream news, business, science, animal welfare, food, philanthropy and activism.
  • Leverage existing media and influencer relationships, and cultivate new contacts.
  • Oversee our media speaking points and FAQ’s, including creating or updating the content.
  • Media train our Grassroots, Open Wing Alliance (and other) team members in talking to the media, managing interviews and conducting follow-ups.
  • Partner with, and support, our Int’l communications team members in developing local PR strategies and leading local media and influencer relations.
  • Work intra-departmentally with our Campaigns team and across the organization to ensure our messaging is powerful, clear, consistent and optimized.
  • Manage our press portal and update media mentions, as needed, on our website.
  • Collaborate closely with our communications team, our Grassroots team and others to reach our PR goals and support the broader organization’s aims.
  • Monitor and evaluate success on a quarterly and ongoing basis.
  • Ensure cohesive and consistent brand messaging across our media and influencer relations messaging, in-line with our organization-wide messaging.
  • Maintain a knowledge of changing trends in media and influencer relations and within the animal protection sectors.
  • Manage our strategic and day-to-day PR work with sensitivity, upholding and building our positive reputation.

    • QUALIFICATIONS

    Required Skills
    • Experience working in PR / Communications with agencies, non-profits or for profit organizations.
    • Excellent persuasive written and verbal communications skills.
    • A knack for building relationships with targeted national, local and international media across a variety of mediums, including: online media, print media, broadcast and podcasts/radio.
    • A proven track record in securing highly visible feature stories in leading media outlets.
    • Influencer relations experience, working with celebrities and/or influencers.
    • Experience crafting big creative media pitches, 1:1 outreach and press releases.
    • A cultivated, and active, network of applicable media and influencer contacts.
    • Experience leading others—ideally through direct management, or through project leadership.
    • Experience conducting media trainings / providing strategic interview counsel for team members.
    • A can do, relentless and inherently positive attitude.
    • An authentic alignment with our mission and animal protection work.

      • Desired Skills
      • A strong working knowledge, and professional use, of social media platforms, such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterest, Tumblr, Reddit.
      • Experience in crisis communications / crisis management.
      • Experience with project management processes and programs, such as Asana.

        • Starting salary $59,000, commensurate with experience.

        Employees enjoy full medical coverage, optional dental and vision packages, a 401(k) retirement plan, working from home, flexible holiday and vacation time, room for advancement, and the supportive environment at The Humane League!

        The Humane League is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Women, people of color, people with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. In compliance with laws and in furtherance of our commitment to fostering an environment that welcomes and embraces diversity, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

Marketing Manager (saas)


Filestage

**About Us**

At [Filestage](https://filestage.io/) we believe that broken workflows poison teams with miscommunication, friction, and frustration. Our mission is to fuel creative teams with a rock-solid workflow. With our software, we empower people to produce great results together and build healthy and meaningful relationships at work.
Over 500 companies (and growing!) all over the world like Lufthansa, Can Tire or Jung von Matt benefit from happier and more productive employees with Filestage. We work hard to build great things together — and make time to celebrate our accomplishments.

**Your mission**
* **You own marketing.** You plan and execute the strategy to attract new people, win marketing qualified leads, and move users through each stage of the marketing funnel.
* **You lead all marketing activities.** You create marketing ideas, prioritize actions, implement tactics and ensure that we’re moving in the right direction.
* **You create a marketing machine.** You make sure that we grow steadily and win new clients by attracting quality leads. So you build, coach and grow the marketing team and you create the right environment to grow.

**You’re good at**
* **You’re a strategic thinker with a creative mindset and analytical skills.** You’re familiar with KPIs, can think outside of the box, enjoy networking with people, and like marketing strategy.
* **You’re passionate about marketing and growth.** You have professional work experience in marketing. Ideally B2B SaaS/Software. You’re an expert in online marketing, partnerships and/or content.
* **You take ownership.** You are filled with passion to take responsibility and to make things happen. You are an energetic self-starter who wants to make a tangible impact on a rapidly growing product and company.
* **You are a team player.** You understand that we can only be successful as a team. Like everyone else in our great team, you are fair, honest and respectful — and you are ready to have a lot of fun.
* **You are fluent in English.** German is a nice-to-have.

**This is what you get**
* **You have the freedom to work wherever you want.** Come work with us at our office in Stuttgart (Germany) or work remotely.
* **Your opinion matters and your work is valued.** You have the chance to make a difference.
* **You have a steep learning curve** by working hands-on together with highly talented minds.
* **Are you tired of useless meetings and slow decision making?** We have flat hierarchies, no bullshit meetings and we move fast.
* **You work with top-notch technologies and lean processes.** We use Slack, Asana, Hangouts — and of course Filestage — to communicate efficiently.

**What are you waiting for?**
